5 - 5270 North Island New zealand

results.title: Sawyer's View Master Viewing Reel - Hansel and Gretel
results.material_description: View Master viewing reel in paper envelope
results.brief_description:
View Master Viewing Reels from Sawyer’s, Inc.
FT-2 Hansel and gretel.
Originally Part 7 of P179116, individual record made for location tracking/ XOS purposes while on display (BUT it is on display in MI-08-C01 with the other reels from P179116? fmm 1/4/21)

results.title:
Radio Rythm, No. A9-1-2A
Vitaphone record
results.brief_description: Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. Vitaphone was the last major analog sound-on-disc system and the only one which was widely used and commercially successful.
results.description: Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. Vitaphone was the last major analog sound-on-disc system and the only one which was widely used and commercially successful.

results.title: Charles Hackett, 392 Reel Three Vitaphone record
results.brief_description:
Reel three of a short film about tenor singer Charles Hackett.

Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. Vitaphone was the last major analog sound-on-disc system and the only one which was widely used and commercially successful.
